column3: If `"pull requests."` is good grammar, the grammar is bad.\n\nNACK
Agree with @paveljanik, neither change seems to be fixing any grammar.

Although this is marked Trivial, I request that you reopen this [because of the following reasons](https://www.quora.com/Should-the-quotation-mark-be-placed-before-or-after-a-period-comma).\n\nAlternatively, please retract statements you have made that "grammar is bad" - @paveljanik - and that "neither change seems to be fixing any grammar" - @fanquake - and then propose a new issue dealing with
I can't retract my opinion. I'm non English native speaker, do not care about en_US and en_UK differences and do not care about your side in that "fight".

@paveljanik It's an interesting position, not to care about someone else's thoughts or views.  It's not a fight, but it is a legitimate question.  As said, trivial, but look at it like this.  What logic is there in imposing UK grammar on everybody who is using English?  \n\nIt strikes me that (again, as pointed out) that although this is trivial, it is worth a bit of discussion.

Please don't tag me in this, I have no duck in this fight. Life is too short to have long arguments about minor language issues IMO. I try to focus on changes affecting performance, user experience, stability and testing.
Not intended to be a fight, as mentioned, but if you are focusing on changes affecting user experience, this would be one of them.
